holidays.name: National Stress Awareness Day
holidays.description: A day dedicated to recognizing and managing stress, encouraging relaxation and self-care.
holidays.origin: Began in the 1990s as part of mental health awareness initiatives.
holidays.funFact: Despite being about stress, people often celebrate by indulging in stress-busting activities like bubble baths and dance parties!

holidays.name: Save the Elephant Day
holidays.description: A day to raise awareness about the plight of elephants and promote conservation efforts to protect them.
holidays.origin: Established by wildlife organizations in the early 2000s to combat poaching and habitat loss.
holidays.funFact: Elephants are one of the few animals that can recognize themselves in a mirror, showcasing their intelligence.

holidays.name: Wear Your Pajamas to Work Day
holidays.description: Encourages people to ditch workday formalities and wear pajamas to their workplace for a dose of comfort and fun.
holidays.origin: Unofficial, popularized via social media trends and workplace morale boosters.
holidays.funFact: Some companies have embraced this day as a booster for creativity and relaxed thinking during meetings.

holidays.name: Caramel Custard Day
holidays.description: A delicious celebration of the creamy dessert caramel custard, enjoyed worldwide in various forms.
holidays.origin: Origin unclear, but celebrated by food lovers and dessert fans.
holidays.funFact: Caramel custard is also known as flan and has roots tracing back to medieval Europe!
